revised_title: Establishment of the Defence Services Research Facilities Committee
tldr: The Royal Society established the Defence Services Research Facilities Committee to streamline scientific research collaborations between the three services (Army, Navy, and Air). The committee aimed to control research under one body instead of separate advisory committees. Members from the Royal Society, Admiralty, War Office, Air Ministry, and Ministry of Supply were involved. Panels were formed to cover specific projects, such as submarine gravity measurements.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Military Science
